column4: if I have 80GB of space, and I need to have a fat32 partition to make it possible to share data between winxp & ubuntu => how should I divide the 80GB?

It depends on how you use your space. If you have loads of huge games for windows then you will obviously need lots of space for windows. If you have loads of movies you want to share then you will want more fat32.
I have 250GB hard drive (but I only use Linux). I have 20GB for my system and 200GB for my personal files (in a subdir of my home)
You shouldn't need more than maybe 10GB for an Ubuntu system with a few big games (like VegaStrike) but if you have the space then there is no harm
